text: in 2010 a powerful earthquake flattened
the isolated tibetan city of yu Shu
killing thousands and leaving a hundred
thousand homeless it was one of China's
worst natural disasters in recent memory
since then the Chinese government is
spared no expense spending over seven
million dollars to completely rebuild
the city from the ground up me gusta
Medina man to Syria hua jai guru
Angelina ha some Bochy does a simple
jack does the Rue de locas had a mini me
don't need wrong invite you busy but the
rebuilding of yu Shu has not been
without its problems here at the ancient
hilltop Jaggu monastery construction
suddenly ground to a halt last year
after the contractor reportedly ran out
of money even though monks were among
the first to claw through the rubble
looking for earthquake survivors today
unfinished buildings litter the
monastery with nowhere to go hundreds of
monks and nuns are still living in tents
the vast sums of money that floated into
the city from the central government
have aggravated already strained
relations between the city's tibetan
majority and the ethnic han migrants who
owned most of the local businesses some
people complain that government
officials and Communist Party members
reported multiple homes while ordinary
residents were left to squeeze in small
apartments with up to a dozen people
across the city scores of newly built
structures stand empty but the
government would rather people focus on
a feel-good narrative about the disaster
at a newly built monument commemorating
the earthquake the message is one of
multi-ethnic cooperation and gratitude
the centerpiece of the memorial is an
enormous social style statue carved out
of stone on one side it features heroic
on rescuers and bedraggled Tibetans made
the hammer and sickle on the other side
are smiling appreciative locals thanks
to all of you read the inscription on
the tab
